comments.message: Haven't been McD for sometime and returned to have a family meal together. The kids love McD and we all love the fries. Was enjoying our meal when I realized that when I bit into my Fillet o'fish, I couldn't taste the cheese. I lifted the bun up and realized that it was only half a slice! I thought the service staff could have made a mistake. Checked my sons' burgers and it was the same for theirs. We approached the counter staff and they confirmed that it has been the case for sometime. I felt disappointed. Part of the delicious part of the burger was the cheese. Why did McD make this decision? The price decrease isn't a real decrease then if the quantity served is reduced. Pls give your customers their due for what we paid to eat and enjoy. I've always enjoyed my occasional treat at McD but the last visit was a disappointment cos it seems like McD is scrimping on ingredients. Hope McD will not continue to compromise on its quality and quantity of food served to her customers.
The nacho cheese was soooo little. .disappointed.

Am sure to support mc Donald becos 90% of their workers n sgreans n I feel so proud n happy while ordering my meal......senior aunty,young malay student who is working as part timer,full time Chinese,malay n indian worker,i love mc Donald becos it's sgrean serving sgrean

McDonald's Singapore I tried the Nacho Cheese Fillet O Fish meal - it might be impossible to change the process but if you put the cheese first on the fish patter and then sprinkle the lettuce on it, it holds the vegetable better. There was hardly any lettuce on mine and the shredded lettuce just seems to be negligible at times. And yes, I would like a proper large portion of fries when I order a large one, and not a medium size portion. I have ordered a medium sized one and a large one and poured them out on the serving tray. They look almost the same with a few more pieces of fries in the large order. Serving staff should not be shy in shovelling a full large portion and take the trouble to widen the container properly. I feel awkward sending the fries back to be filled up again again but I am not getting what I paid for at all.
http://www.travellingmcds.com/2014/02/nacho-cheese-filet-o-fish-singapore.html

Mcdonalds has become more efficient and innovative thru out these years. It's the only fast food chain that I see keep improving itself as the environment changes.
